column2: the places is pretty no frills. Long
column3: communal seats. Order at the counter. Awesome smell of meat wafting throughout. To see the place
column4: pricing seems a little on the expensive side- until you taste the food. Clearly a ton of time and attention has been put into smoking the nice selection- including ribs (baby back/st. louis)
column7: chicken and sausage. You can a sandwich
column8: but I'd recommend going with a platter- if in a group you can get a hearty sample of the different meats
column9: served on paper/cafeteria tray. I've had the baby backs
